conservative.name: Conservative
conservative.description: Lower bound estimate with small particles and low density polymers

median.name: Median (Literature)
median.description: Based on Kooi et al. (2021) and observed distributions

optimistic.name: Optimistic
optimistic.description: Upper bound with larger particles and high density polymers

shape_distribution.title: Shape Probability Distribution
shape_distribution.what: Observed shape frequencies in environmental samples
shape_distribution.why: Different shapes have different volume-to-size relationships
shape_distribution.how_to_read: Higher bars = more common in observations

polymer_distribution.title: Polymer Type Distribution
polymer_distribution.what: Observed polymer composition from field studies
polymer_distribution.why: Polymer density directly affects particle mass

size_distribution.title: Size Distribution (Power Law)
size_distribution.why: Smaller particles are exponentially more abundant
size_distribution.how_to_read: Log scale: steep slope = more small particles

mass_distribution.title: Particle Mass Distribution
mass_distribution.why: Shows spread in mass per particle
mass_distribution.how_to_read: Vertical lines mark quantiles (P5, P50, P95)

surface_p5.title: P5 (Lower Bound) Surface
surface_p5.why: Conservative estimate - only 5% of particles are lighter
surface_p5.how_to_read: Red peak = highest flux, blue = lowest. Extrema marked.

surface_p50.title: P50 (Median) Surface
surface_p50.why: Best estimate - half particles lighter, half heavier

surface_p95.title: P95 (Upper Bound) Surface
surface_p95.why: Optimistic estimate - only 5% of particles are heavier
